JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: PhD Special Call: PhD for research project on research integrity and responsible conduct of research
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The Graduate School at Aarhus BBS and the PhD programme in Social Sciences and Business invites application for a fully funded three year PhD scholarship focused on the study of research integrity and responsible conduct of research. The PhD fellowship is available as of September 1 2022.


The research project

The PhD fellowship is part of the research project: ETHOS – Exploring Research Integrity Policies and Practices in ”the Houses of Science” led by Associate Professor Lise Degn at the Danish Centre for Studies in Research and Research Policy (CFA), Department of Political Science. The project focuses on how academic and public discourses shape the problem of research integrity and how such problematizations affect academic practices and perceptions. The PhD project particularly should focus on how integrity issues emerge in the daily lives of ‘work-floor’ academics, and should be based on ethnographic fieldwork in at least three research groups across Europe. Interested applicants may read more about the ETHOS project, and the initial outline of the PhD project here.


Job description

The successful candidate will be enrolled as a PhD student at the Graduate School Aarhus BSS, with the aim of completing a PhD degree at the PhD programme in Social Sciences and Business. While the successful candidate’s work will culminate in the submission of a PhD dissertation, she or he will be expected to participate in both research group research activities (e.g., workshops, seminars, etc.) throughout the period of her or his employment, as well as activities at the place of employment, the Danish Centre for Studies in Research and Research Policy. The PhD will involve ethnographic fieldwork in at least three research groups across Europe, so extended periods of travel abroad should be expected. The exact timing, nature and duration of the fieldwork will be determined in collaboration with the successful candidate. Additionally, a mandatory 840 hours of teaching or knowledge dissemination activities is entailed in the PhD degree programme in Social Sciences and Business. The precise nature of this task will be planned with the project supervisor(s). For more information on the guidelines for PhD students at the PhD programme in Social Sciences and Business, see here: https://bss.au.dk/en/research/phd/programmes/social-sciences-and-business/guidelines-for-phd-students



Qualifications

The successful applicant could have a background in social sciences, e.g. sociology, political science or closely related disciplines (incl. anthropology, ethnography etc.), but this is no precondition. Previous experience with ethnographic research/methods would be considered a strong advantage, as would an existing interest in research practices, responsible research and research integrity and/or ethics. The submitted project proposal should fall within the scope of the overall project, but applicants are encouraged to develop project proposals that suit their own strengths and interests. Potential applicants are welcome to seek further information and discuss project ideas (see contact information below) prior to submitting applications.



Further information

For further information about the position, please contact Associate professor Lise Degn, Email: ld@ps.au.dk, Tel.: + 45 93508923.

If you need help uploading your application or have any questions about the recruitment process, please contact HR supporter Regitze Arnbjerg, Tel.: +45 93521414, Email: rma@au.dk


Place of work

Bartholins Allé 7, 8000 Aarhus C




Formal requirements

You can read more about how to apply in the application guide and find the rules and regulations of the PhD education here.

The following criteria are decisive in the assessment of the candidates:
  • the applicant’s academic qualifications (assessed on the basis of the qualifying degree)
  • the quality and relevance of the project proposal
  • the applicant’s level of academic aptitude and assessed ability to complete the project within the framework of the PhD programme
You can read more about the assessment procedure and committees appointed by the dean here.

Please note that Aarhus BSS Graduate School reserves the right to evaluate the applications on the basis of the documentation received before deadline, and you will not necessarily be asked for further documentation. Furthermore, Aarhus BSS Graduate School reserves the right to reject application that do not comply with the limitations as stated in the application guide (see link above).
Aarhus University’s ambition is to be an attractive and inspiring workplace for all and to foster a culture in which each individual has opportunities to thrive, achieve and develop. We view equality and diversity as assets, and we welcome all applicants.


Aarhus University

Aarhus University is an academically diverse and research-intensive university with a strong commitment to high-quality research and education and the development of society nationally and globally. The university offers an inspiring research and teaching environment to its 39,000 students, including 1,800 PhD students, and 8,000 employees, and has an annual revenues of EUR 884 million. Learn more about the PhD programmes at Aarhus University at www.phd.au.dk.
